content: this legal text is about a case involving coownership property the case started in march 2015 and went through two instances of court the final resolution resulted in the dissolution of the coownership and the creation of two new cadastral plots one plot was awarded to the petitioner js and the other plot was awarded to the counterparties rp bo pd with a ½ share the decision was based on the property act the firstinstance court explained that the parties agreed on a method for conducting the division which the court adopted the petitioner requested reimbursement of procedural costs but the counterparties opposed and insisted that the petitioner should bear the entire cost however an agreement was reached regarding the allocation of procedural costs the court determined that the justified and necessary costs for the coownership dissolution amounted to hrk 902504 which included investigation surveying expertise and preparation of a parcelization plan an additional amount of hrk 20000 for court fees was also considered since the petitioner covered the costs the counterparties were obliged to reimburse the petitioner hrk 461 in this legal text party a is challenging the decision to split costs with party b party a argues that they gained valuable property during the dissolution while party b received land they claim that the costs increased because party a built structures on the property without party bs knowledge party a also argues that they agreed that party b would cover the costs the court determined that in coownership dissolution cases the costs should be divided proportionally unless there is a specific agreement stating otherwise the court also considered the rules from a previous law which determine that the party whose interest the proceedings serve should bear the costs since party a independently constructed the property without party bs approval the decision to split the costs was deemed appropriate the court specifically established that the costs for preparing the parcelization plan amount to hrk 612 the petitioner in this legal case is the main party involved and they became the exclusive owner of a property they also incurred costs for construction experts and the valuation of objects on the property the other parties involved are responsible for reimbursing the petitioner for a portion of the procedural costs the firstinstance decision regarding costs was amended according to the law on civil procedure
